pages.text: Lobodiscus tribrachialis comes from the Upper Ediacaran, with fossils found in the Dengying Formation, South China. It is a small, rounded lifeform, growing up to 4 cm in diameter. It is noted for its 3 long, curved lobe structures, giving it a rare tri-radial symmetry, something not seen in modern phylums. It is also the first possible 'animal' fossil from the Dengying Formation, and is also the youngest known trilobozoan in the fossil record.

The generic name derives from the Latin words 'Lobus', to mean 'lobe'; and 'discus', to mean 'disc'. The specific name derives from the Latin words 'tres', to mean 'three'; and 'brachium', to mean 'arm'.
